alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Liberty; Polk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:58AM CST until January 11 at 2:40PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Polk, Hardin and Liberty Counties. For the Menard Creek...including Rye...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menard Creek near Rye. * WHEN...From this morning to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as low lying areas along the creek are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Sunday the stage was 23.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CST Sunday was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 11/15/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Menard Creek Rye 20.0 23.4 Sun 8 am CST 24.0 19.5 13.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CST.
